website_summaries.verdict: A set of communication cards suitable for multiple disabilities, including Down syndrome and autism.
pros: Kids use cards to express a number of thoughts and ideas
This solution minimizes anxiety and builds confidence
High-quality cards are held together with a sturdy clip
cons: A few buyers say some of the pictures aren't relatable

customer_reviews.title: Not for preschool or kindergarten children
customer_reviews.text: Product was a good size and ring was provided, however half of the cards were not usable. The drink card had a shirtless man scoffing down water. The pictures were not preschool relatable.
customer_reviews.author: pamela

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Gift & Toy for All Young Children
customer_reviews.text: I'm always on the look out for gifts and toys for my children, and I am always disappointed at how difficult it is to find things that are good for their development. After buying these cards for my children, I saw the immense value they brought in their development. Now, these cards are a go-to item for me to buy that I know will be enjoyable for anyone who has young children. A very easy gift!
customer_reviews.author: kate kim

customer_reviews.title: Good for children in need of help
customer_reviews.text: This product fulfils its purpose which is to help children with speech disabilities. Unlike other brands that are filled with negative phrases, this one tries to encourage uses of more positive phrases.
customer_reviews.author: Youne

customer_reviews.title: Works for children elementary age.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a Additional Assistant in a elementary school and work with children who has autism. My 1st grader needed something to help with prompts, and getting motivation, without verbal justification . I decided to order these praying that they work, and they did just that.🙂 when I introduced them I saw an automatic change in behavior.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Family is so excited to start using this tool to help their non verbal kids communicate.
customer_reviews.text: These are WONDERFUL!! They are a lot smaller than I thought, it would be great if they were bigger.
customer_reviews.author: KAC40

customer_reviews.title: Helps!
customer_reviews.text: Great for my 4 yr old nonverbal ASD son. Wish it had more picks like things he eats and plays with but overall cool.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Needs to more cards included
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't what I thought it was I thought it would be more foods more pictures of general items I'm working with kids 0 to 3 it doesn't have enough to work with or should have been more cards included with more variety of objects. It was too difficult of pictures for 0-3 i didn't see an age recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Good for nonverbal students
customer_reviews.text: Durable, high quality, and perfect for use with nonverbal students.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie D

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids that are shy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loves this it going to help her communicate much better in school. Shes a bit shy👍👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: Good amount of communication cards
customer_reviews.text: Good amount of PEC cards. Only thing I’d change is maybe laminate them? My kiddos no and yes are barley hanging on my a thread these days.
customer_reviews.author: taylor

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the product
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived as advertised and has a nice range of cards that can describe various important emotions.
customer_reviews.author: Pavlos

customer_reviews.title: Read description
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t read the description- I was looking for larger flash cards. Seller describes fine.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Bey

customer_reviews.title: good idea, bad execution
customer_reviews.text: good words and phrases, some of the pictures we a little complex and kind of odd.
customer_reviews.author: ligaya

customer_reviews.title: High quality cards, great for young kids!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this product! The cards are of a very high quality and have a wide range of phrases to allow nonverbal kids to express themselves
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: quick and convenient
customer_reviews.text: simple and easy to use and understand. small and convenient to keep in purse, pocket, etc. pretty convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Tong

customer_reviews.title: 90% unhappy with these cards.
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in these cards...If you have a child/adult with an intellectual disability,bypass these.I purchased for my son and im regretting it.
customer_reviews.author: Gemini Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: Thin card stock. Good pics but the size is far too small to be effective. I have small hands and it fits in the palm of my hand
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: too expensive
customer_reviews.text: The book is very small, not worth the price,This price is too expensive
customer_reviews.author: ludanou

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Be careful about the size, too small to be useful for a normal kid, not to mention special need kids
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

product_meta.title: Communication Cards: Show to Tell Basic Phrases with Pictures - 2.5 x 2.5 inches (Preschool Level)
product_meta.description:
Material Type:No Book Ring

 Show to Tell Cards by Sensory Mama 

 22 visual aid cards with easy to understand images and the following phrases: 

 Hungry, Thirsty, Please Give Me, No Thank You, Let’s Share, Bathroom, All Done, Let’s Go, Eyes Are Watching, Ears Are Listening, Voice Is Quiet, Body Is Calm, Slow Breaths, Gentle Hands, Hug, Wait, Stop, Go, Yes, No, High Five, Good Job. 

 Useful for all ages and abilities

 Show to Tell Communication Cards were created by a physical therapist working with preschool children with autism, language delays, and behavior challenges. Visual aids can help a child with: 

 - processing and communicating wants and needs
- understanding a directed task
- reinforcing positive behavior 
- understanding rules at home or in the classroom
- improving vocabulary and language
- communicating after a stroke or brain injury



 The phrases were carefully selected as the building blocks for communication at any age. 

How to use  Cards are 2.5 inches by 2.5 inches and come with a zip-lock bag for easy on the go storage. You customize their use to suit your unique needs or choose our option that is ready to be connected with an included book ring. 

#1 Tip for getting started: introduce picture cards when your child is calm, fed, and rested so that their brain will be ready for learning. We recommended that your child has a good understanding of the meaning of a card before attempting to use it in a stressful situation.
feature_bullets: PUT THE POWER OF PICTURES IN A CHILD'S HANDS with 22 basic phrases for every day interactions.
BUILD CONFIDENCE NOT ANXIETY: You can prevent frustrations, establish routines, and improve relationships.
RESEARCH-BASED PSYCHOLOGY OF POSITIVE PARENTING: Gentle language empowers your child to thrive. Pictures help children to express their needs and understand expectations in social situations.
USEFUL FOR ALL AGES AND ABILITIES: Our cards are appropriate for behavior challenges, autism, Down syndrome, special needs, nonverbal, and language impairment at any age
LAUNCHED IN 2019: each card is 2.5 x 2.5 inches and printed on high quality casino grade playing cards. Packaging is minimized to decrease excess waste.
